output: For each test case, print a line containing the largest possible sum of the sizes of the control fields that can be created. Round and print the answer with exactly two decimal places.
input: The input contains several test cases. The first line of each test case contains an integer N (3 ≤ N ≤ 105) giving the number of portals. The next N lines contains two integer xi and yi each (0 ≤ xi, yi ≤ 104), indicating the coordinates of the portals in the map.The input ends with end-of-file (EOF).
name: Ingrest
description:
Ingrest is a augmented reality game widely played across the world. In this game, two factions battle each other in order to control areas in the world.

The game map can be described as a plane. There are N portals in the map. A portal i can be described as a point (xi,yi) on the plane.

For each pair of distinct portals, a player can create a link between them.
When a link between two portals is created, a line segment connecting them is
drawn on the map. Given three distinct portals, when there is a link between each pair of these three portals, a control field is created. A control field is defined as the triangle formed by the links connecting the portals. The size of a control field is defined as the area of this triangle.

According to the game rules, two distinct control fields cannot have a positive-area intersection. Hence, two control fields may share at most a single link or a single portal.

Given the positions of all portals in the map, determine the largest possible sum of the sizes of the control fields that can be created.
